description.narrative: Empower researchers to collaborate internationally, and gain access to new research environments, facilities, knowledge, and expertise, in order to enhance the quality of their research and enable them to translate research and innovation into economic and societal benefit. -Focusing on topics or themes which have relevance to the economic development and welfare of Turkey, create opportunities for sustainable, solution-oriented research and innovation collaborations between academic groups as well as with the private and third sector. - Support dialogue and knowledge exchange on academic standards, research governance and strategic research policy development to help promote an academic and research environment, between Turkey and the UK, to achieve maximum impact from high quality research.

Newton - Katip Celebi Fund has been supporting bilateral research projects between Turkey and the UK since 2014. Through a wide range of programmes, researchers from different scientific backgrounds came together to create joint solutions and a positive socio-economic impact in Turkey. Over 130 direct academic connections were created and projects with a broad area of topics, including but not limited to health, environment, material sciences and migration, were assisted. Under different programme schemes, young researchers were supported through their PhD, workshops were organised to share and enrich academic knowledge, joint research teams were created for in-depth research projects and institutional capacity building was enabled through know-how exchange.

Researchers at higher education institutions in Turkey and the UK, including early carreer Researchers - I3Science and innovation focused policy making institutions - Private and third sector with research and development capacity.

The Scientific and Technological Research Council of Turkey (TUBITAK) has been the major in-country partner for Newton - Katip Celebi Fund since 2014. Institutional Links Programme, which was referred by TUBITAK as the flagship of research and innovation programmes between Turkey and the UK, has been a best practice and the number of applications for each year's call was more than the year before.
